content:
Bali has many beautiful places that offer both mountains and beaches. Here are some options for you to consider:

1. Ubud - Located in the central part of Bali, Ubud is a town surrounded by lush green forests and rice paddies. It is also known as the cultural hub of Bali and offers stunning mountain views, temples, and art galleries. While there are no beaches in Ubud, it is close enough to the coast to take day trips to some of Bali's best beaches.
2. Lovina - Located in the northern part of Bali, Lovina is a quiet beach town known for its black sand beaches and calm waters. It is also close to the beautiful mountains of Bali, including Mount Batur and Mount Agung.
3. Amed - Located on the eastern coast of Bali, Amed is a peaceful fishing village that offers stunning mountain views and some of the island's best snorkeling and diving spots. It is also a great starting point for hiking Mount Agung.
4. Jimbaran - Located on the southern coast of Bali, Jimbaran is a beach town known for its beautiful white sand beaches and seafood restaurants. It also offers stunning views of the nearby mountains and is a great base for day trips to some of Bali's popular mountain destinations, such as Bedugul and Munduk.

Each of these places offers its unique charm and attractions, so you may want to consider your preferences and interests to decide which one suits you best.
